intro: Jurinea carduiformis, commonly known as the cardueous jurinea, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand harsh, dry conditions. Its leaves are generally gray-green and covered in a fine layer of hair to reduce water loss. Jurinea carduiformis produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators.
